intro: Parnassia mucronata, commonly known as the blunt-lobed parnassia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, cup-shaped flowers that are often adorned with dark veins. Its leaves are typically palmately divided, with a distinctive lobed structure. Parnassia mucronata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and alpine meadows.
